Job Title: Associate Sales Representative / Clinical Support

Location: Orlando, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Company Overview:Restech supplies innovative, minimally invasive tools and therapies that help to accurately diagnose, manage, and treat reflux disorders. 
Position Overview:This position will support current customers with the proper use of our products, and expand customer base by cultivating new leads. 
Key Responsibilities:Physician Education:Educating physicians and staff in the operating room/endoscopy suite on the Stretta minimally invasive antireflux procedure.Conduct training sessions and workshops for physicians on the Stretta procedure, ensuring proper technique and adherence to best practices.Provide ongoing support and guidance to physicians in the field, addressing any questions or concerns related to the procedure or device usage.Stay up-to-date on clinical research, industry trends, and competitor products to effectively communicate the benefits of our technology. 
Operating Room/Endoscopy Suite Staff Training:Work with OR/Endo Staff to ensure proper protocol is followed during Stretta procedures.Inservice/Educate staff on equipment set-up, intraprocedural techniques, and procedural protocols to maintain a safe and efficient environment.
Clinic Support:Supporting clinic personnel on the proper use and application of the Restech Dx-pH Measurement System. Assist clinic staff with the set-up of Restech Dx-pH Study procedures, including patient preparation, equipment setup, and data interpretation.Provide troubleshooting assistance and technical support to clinics.Foster strong relationships with clinic administrators and staff to promote customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Customer Engagement and Relationship Building:Build strong relationships with key opinion leaders, healthcare providers, and professional organizations. Attend medical conferences, seminars, and trade shows to represent the company and engage with potential customers and partners.
Clinical Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate records of training activities and support interactions for internal reporting and regulatory compliance.Collect data and feedback from healthcare professionals, contributing to the continuous improvement of our products and services.
Qualifications: Experience in a clinical support role within the medical field. Experience as a Surgical Technologist (Scrub Tech), Endoscopy Tech, EMT/Paramedic, etc. is preferred.Certification or training in relevant medical technologies and procedures is a plus.Willingness to travel within the United States to customer sites, conferences, and training events as needed.Ability to adhere to the requirements of vendor credentialing for hospital access.Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information to diverse audiences.Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines.Strong proficiency in fundamental computer skills, including proficiency with Google G Suite and familiarity with CRM Platforms.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex issues.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Excellent organizational skills. Valid Driverâ€™s license. 
Join Our Team:If you are passionate about making a difference in patient care and thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment, we invite you to apply for this position.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to execute each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
